definitions.definition: an award that is given to a person who wins a competition, race, etc. or who does very good work
definitions.sensetop: prize for somethingprize for doing something

examples.text: He **won first prize** in the woodwind section.
The **prize went to** the grey long-haired cat.
She has **received** numerous **prizes** for her work.
There are **no prizes for guessing** *(= it is very easy to guess)* who she was with.
The **grand prize** is a family trip to Hawaii.
His film took the **top prize** at Cannes last year.
Win a car in our prize draw!
She was the first woman to win this coveted prize.
The prize was presented by the mayor.
prizes in chemistry, physics and medicine
They said the teenager was a worthy winner of the prize.

definitions.definition: something very important or valuable that is difficult to achieve or obtain

examples.text: World peace is the greatest prize of all.
The presidency is the ultimate prize.

wordOrigin: Middle English: the noun, a variant of price; the verb (originally in the sense ‘estimate the value of’) from Old French pris-, stem of preisier ‘to praise, appraise’, from late Latin pretiare, from Latin pretium ‘price’.
